intro: Caruncularia pedunculata, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, yellowish seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided in agricultural settings.
